name: Wasted time on a gem?
title: Wasted time on a gem?
text: Years ago, I spent over 50 hours to 100% this game. All achievements, zen garden, minigames, etc.. Afterwards, I deleted the app since I was done with it. Now I‚Äôve redownloaded it and regret doing that, I‚Äôve lost everything. There should be save data backups for a game of this caliber.

name: Is This Even Legal?!?!
title: Is This Even Legal?!?!
text: How can a game I‚Äôve owned for years suddenly undo all of my IAPs and turn itself into a free to pay piece of scam work that cancels out what money I‚Äôve spent & items I‚Äôve unlocked? Where‚Äôs my refund when all that‚Äôs left is 1 giant ad of a game? If doing that works one way then it should work both ways & give back every cent to anyone who bought the full version before this crooked EA, the DJT of the gaming world, took over. One does not earn the Most Hated Company in America title easily. Never EVER give a cent to an EA game because they can & will & HAVE stolen what we once owned. Literally bought & owned this game and now do not. That‚Äôs sickening. How is that even a viable long-term model? It‚Äôs like if garbage morphed into game developer form.A year later: reinstalled.  Still getting ads, still no restore option.    Typical EA.

name: What have they done here!?
title: What have they done here!?
text: So I decided to get the game again to play it again since I liked the game a few years ago, but now it‚Äôs just wrong. For some reason there are adds everywhere, random promotional stuff all over the place you can‚Äôt turn off, more clicks for more adds, it‚Äôs disgusting. It completely breaks the game loop to suddenly have a 30 second add in the middle of it. Maybe you can get rid of all of them in the store once you unlock it, but until then you have to go through this abomination. The sounds also broken in a lot of places for some reason. Another property EA couldn‚Äôt care less about other than for money. Disgusting.

name: More ads than games
title: More ads than games
text: This used to be a favorite, but now it has so many ads that 5 minutes of play interrupted by 4 or 5 ads. I‚Äôm okay wwith ads that I choose to watch for some benefit in-game, but they literally have ads before and after (and sometimes during) each level‚Ä¶and the only benefit is that you n keep playing? No thanks, when there are plenty of other games out there.Yuck to a previously fun game.

name: VIDEO GAME PERFECTION
title: VIDEO GAME PERFECTION
text: Plants vs Zombies will always hold a special place in my empty heart. Every like, TEN levels it COMPLETELY changes your environment so it‚Äôs alway fresh and keeps you engaged. Never once did I feel like it was getting stale, or they kept reusing the same concept. I can‚Äôt put into words how GOOD the soundtrack is. just ICONIC. Even after you beat Zomboss and get to see the FANTASTIC MUSIC VIDEO, there‚Äôs almost an INFINITE amount of other content to play. There‚Äôs nothing more satisfying then planting the last peashooter in a lane, and looking at the beautiful lawn defense you‚Äôve set up, until you get enough sun for another peashooter and... well you know... Anyway GREAT game I would recommend it to ANYBODY.

name: Another game.. Ruined.
title: Another game.. Ruined.
text: PopCap, I really like your games and played your games for years. But, PvZ was the BEST OUT OF ALL!! But why sometime you have to make EA buy Pvz? I do not mind EA ruining PvZ 2 because it was a money maker and the art design, Did not have the same feel to it. But you HAVE to delete hidden codes, like you could put a gui that does it. And why did you remake the plants looks like, It does not look the same and I am not used to it. But this one actually makes me upset. YOU. REMOVED. HORDE. MUSIC!! This was my favorite kind of music in the game! I Loved just hear the night time horde music. IT WAS AMAZING!! If you do not know what I mean about horde music I will tell you about it. It is music that plays if a large horde of zombies appear. It is amazing. It is like the normal music but it has different sounds and sometimes even different parts of music that plays (Like night time horde). And dont forget the wisdom tree. Please add it back to the game, I already told you about the gui will fix the codes it gives you so, Add it back in! Also, Please put the menu like the PC except a few changes. 1. The grave will have the more ways to support small screen devices.2. When you select a level, Please add the zombie hand coming out. It is a cool thing from PC version. Add the music to it too3. Bonus game and zombie will still be there. Also the huge tree will stay same on left.Hey, Also why not have the zen garden music to the plant unlock screen and also add zombatar again. (It is a thing that is on the menu on PvZ GOTY Edition (Game of the year Edition). Please also make it so you can also remove ads forever.Thanks for reading!! Please make it better with these!

title: The original Plants vs Zombies (PvsZ)
name: The original Plants vs Zombies (PvsZ)
text: The hope is that sequels are better than the original and they definitely are but, truth be told, there‚Äôs nothing wrong with the original.  It‚Äôs not just a great way to pass time, you know, without actually getting up off the couch, it‚Äôs fun and can be challenging.  There are nine levels in each game and there are multiple environments in which you have to hold off the zombies which require different tools and strategies to succeed‚Ä¶so if you barely survived with your brain intact after the ‚Äònight‚Äô level you could be in your element in the ‚Äòpool‚Äô.  Additionally there are several mini-games and puzzles if you just need a break from unrelenting waves of zombies.  From the very beginning of the game you are bombarded with ads but you can escape this dreaded fate simply by clicking to eliminate those annoying babies.  It will cost you a whopping $2.99 and it‚Äôs worth every penny.  Seriously though 3 bucks is more than a reasonable amount to pay for a game this well developed and so much fun to boot.  I can‚Äôt tell you the name of the developer/ developers but I can say he/she doesn‚Äôt suffer from at least one of the seven deadly sins‚Ä¶greed. üòâ I played this game many times and have only had to spend any ‚Äòreal‚Äô money once, to eliminate ads and that was a personal choice, not a requirement to play the game. Go ahead click to get the game, you‚Äôll like it well enough to look forward to playing the sequels.

title: Such a Memorable Classic!
name: Such a Memorable Classic!
text: Everybody knows this classic series, and even though it‚Äôs currently broad (until PVZ3 gets released), the first game is WAY more fun than it looks. The reason it‚Äôs so popular with beginners and professionals is because the game is easy to play, but hard to master. Even after you complete Adventure Mode (1 & 2), There‚Äôs still so much to do, especially mini games! My favorite is I, Zombie, where you take control of the zombies and play from their perspective. My only criticism to the game is the micro transactions. I mean, I get it, EA now owns PopCap (cry about it), and EA is infamous for their sextillion micro transactions. But, once you take away the micro transactions, PVZ becomes a fun game! As soon as it becomes repetitive, the game hits you with a game changing plant or zombie, like the menacing, 3 feet tall Gargantuar, or the strong Doom-Shroom! Overall, this game used to be perfect before EA came to the scene, however, it‚Äôs still fun! If you haven‚Äôt played this game yet (Like, seriously? Been living under a rock) PLAY IT, it‚Äôs a must-play!

title: Great game, A LOT OF ADS
name: Great game, A LOT OF ADS
text: Really, really awesome game. 3 stars because of excessive ads. I‚Äôm a person that is normally fine with watching ads, but this is too much. The pattern; Game‚Ä¶(insert prize)‚Ä¶but before you see it, watch an ad and before you play another game, watch an ad. It goes Game, Commercial, Commercial, Game, Commercial, Commercial, Game. And‚Ä¶you have to click the arrow for it to move on from the ad, but it takes you to the App Store, then you click ‚Äúback to P v Z,‚Äù but it takes you back to the end of the ad. You click the ‚Äúx‚Äù button, but it takes you to the title of the product, then you hit the ‚Äúx‚Äù again and you go back to the game. Either way, great game. But if you won‚Äôt pay, be prepared to wait. And remember‚Ä¶you can‚Äôt just put down the game during commercials and walk away, then come back‚Ä¶it requires clicks to continue.  Sorry. First and last ever review of a game.

title: The Gameplay of Plants vs. Zombies
text: Hello and welcome to Plants vs. Zombies and I am so glad you are here! For today‚Äôs gameplay, drag the plants in the grass and collect the falling sun. You can get more plants and play more games to play. We are not going to let the zombies inside the house. But it‚Äôs okay. You can play and fight the evil or the zombies. You can use More Ways to Play and play Mini Games Mode or Puzzle Mode. You can buy and get your money at Crazy Dave‚Äôs Shop. Play the Bonus Game with Plants vs. Zombies Gameplay Mode. Leaderboards and Achievements are using Game Center with Turns, Friends, Challenges, Requests and Games. Download on the App Store and search ‚ÄúPlants vs. Zombies‚Äù on the iPhone and iPad. Be good and have fun!

title: Ruined by ads and doesn‚Äôt even function
name: Ruined by ads and doesn‚Äôt even function
text: The mobile version of this game is chock full of ads and video offers. They took the mini game and puzzle system and locked them behind tons of coins just to convince you to buy them with real money. Even if you choose to buy the no ads option, it‚Äôs still constantly offering ads to you. The survival endless mode gets into a state where it just crashes when you try to open it. So they took an amazing game, filled it with garbage, broke it, and left.

title: Nice!
text: Ok, let‚Äôs get to the point. I love the game. But seriously the ads. If you could just get a paid version of the game, I would rather get it than turn on airplane mode. I love the app though. Suggestion: have a ‚Äúrestart flag‚Äù button in survival. I find it highly annoying having to restart an entire survival when I pick the wrong plant. Also, I really hate that you have to grind forever to just literally get 50,000 coins. I love the Zen Garden as well. It feels awesome just getting coins from watering a marigold. Ok, now that I‚Äôve discussed that, I‚Äôm going to ask for some new plants once and a while. I don‚Äôt think EA taking over is bad, because you have to have ads or a paid game or you won‚Äôt earn any cash from making it. But in pvz2 it‚Äôs way worse. So stop complaining people. To sum up, PvZ is an awesome game. I also love crazy Dave and his rap. Parko Out!

title: My favorite game ever
text: This game is amazing. There is just no other way to describe it. Want more info? Sure. You start out with the tutorial which is very well made, and by the end of it you know exactly what you need to do. The difficulty gradually ramps up, so that you have time to get used to the new zombies. All of the different areas, plants and zombies make it very fun to play. You can never get enough. One of my favorite things about the game is that there is NO MICRO TRANSACTIONS. Unlike PvZ 2, you can‚Äôt buy advantages so that you can get through the game quicker. Take a hike EA. Everybody hates you. You ruined the PvZ franchise because of your greediness. In conclusion it is a great game that I recommend to everyone!!! Hope you have a fun time.

name: Plants vs. Zombies vs. Ads
title: Plants vs. Zombies vs. Ads
text: Bought the OG version many years ago for my old iPad. Decided on a whim to get the new version for my phone. Saw it was free and winced. Sure enough, it‚Äôs laden with ads at every turn and stuff you used to be able to unlock by playing through now costs in-game currency. Fine, fine, such is the way of games these days. I figured buying the ad-free would at least stem some of the nonsense and ‚Ä¶ well, no, the game conveniently forgets about that every time until you remind it. So that‚Äôs a rip-off. And it crashes (a lot) and somehow moves way slower than it did on my decade-old iPad2. EA, nicely done, you‚Äôve turned me off an old favorite.

name: Too many ads
title: Too many ads
text: I remember PvZ fondly. I loved to play it, and I still do, despite beating the game several times. It‚Äôs a delightful puzzle game, with really good ramping up of the difficulty levels, training the player as they play (as opposed to the later games).However. Recently, a new, updated version of PvZ has come out. The format has somewhat changed, which I‚Äôm willing to look past because sometimes things change. But the worst thing is taking a lovely little fun game and adding an inordinate number of ads! Every single time I open up a new level I have to watch 1-2 ads. If I want to do anything on this app I have to watch an ad. And the ads are untenable. When you click the x button it doesn‚Äôt close out, but brings you to the apple store. They are a blight of annoyance that has tainted this wonderful game. PvZ as a franchise has gone so far, I can‚Äôt believe it has come to this.I‚Äôm giving it so many stars to honor what it once was, and as few as a warning of what it has become.

name: Used to be a fun game, now serious hot garbage
title: Used to be a fun game, now serious hot garbage
text: I remember playing PVZ two or three years back, and then playing it again last year. EA has stuffed waaaaaaaay too many ads into this game. Before, you could get an Explode-O-Nut for 3000 coins, now you have to watch an ad for them. All the mini games used to be insta unlocked when you got the mini games mode, now you have to pay a big fat load of 50,000 coins to get five. Also the rate of zombies dropping coins is a lot lower, so I think EA is trying to bribe gamers into thinking it was too hard to grind for those games and then paying for it with real life cash. I really hope this message gets to EA with all the other reviews here. Thanks for reading.  P.S I know what they did to Madden, The Sims, FIFA, Star Wars Battlefront 2, Mass Effect 3, and Need for Speed.

name: Great game, only one problem.
title: Great game, only one problem.
text: I‚Äôve been playing PvZ for years now and it‚Äôs always so relaxing. All of the plants are very creative along with the variations of zombies. I also think the descriptions in the almanac are very funny and always make me laugh. And while the game is relaxing, I find it challenging too,- the roof level is very hard for me and it took a while to complete. What I am saying is that is a great game, and you can bet I will continue to play it for a long time. However, there was but one problem i have had while playing. Whenever I shop at Crazy Dave‚Äôs, and then exit, the game immediately kicks me out. name: Listen I love PvZ with a passion, but this game is a trick
title: Listen I love PvZ with a passion, but this game is a trick
text: Have you fine people wondered why this game doesn‚Äôt capture the same nostalgia as the PvZ you once knew and loved? Check the publisher. That‚Äôs not our beloved Popcap making old moves. That‚Äôs EA getting their hands somewhere it doesn‚Äôt belong again. This game doesn‚Äôt feel like the old one because it‚Äôs not. I‚Äôm sorry EA I love you and I love the Sims, but you‚Äôve once again stuck your grubby little hands where they don‚Äôt belong. I was only able to figure this out because when I noticed this app was free and there was no 99¬¢ option I looked in my recent purchases and there it was. The exact same game (we all know not exact but you get what I‚Äôm saying) same plants, same zombies, different publisher. I didn‚Äôt think anyone could screw up a game already published so badly, but are you folks really so strapped for cash you have to not only put ads before each level, but also offer unremovable ad options for items that no player should be using because it‚Äôs absolutely immersion breaking and just in general not fun like the exploding walnut and extra lawn mowers? I‚Äôm willing to bet I could play a whole game without planting a single plant, and for that you break my heart.

title: The ‚ÄúOld PVZ‚Äù Was Better
text: I‚Äôve had this game for years, a very long time... and it use to be huge back in the day. But when EA and PopCap did a certain update it infested with ad after ad, an ad use to only be used if you CHOSE to watch something for a reward (such as the garden rake at the beginning of each level), and now it‚Äôs impossible to avoid them without messing with your settings. The game, I guarantee you, made a lot of money already as people would spend to get an advantage in the game, and now the game is a big money maker and the people playing have the suffer so to those ads making the money. It has gotten ridiculous. Please cut the ads down because it‚Äôs getting to the point to where I‚Äôm watching ads more than anything. For whatever reason; it seems like games with non stop ads have gotten big and it‚Äôs making it hard to find the ‚Äúgood ole games‚Äù. This review does nothing but hopefully lower the rating average so they will actually read these sometimes.P.S. was looking at why the average is so high... the non stop 5 star ratings are before they introduced the ‚Äúnon-stop ad update‚Äù now they get plenty of 1-3 stars, just like this one.

name: Amazing game, but big bug in the beginning
title: Amazing game, but big bug in the beginning
text: I used to play PVZ a TON when I was a kid, and I was addicted to it. It was so fun, and I would always play it. Years later, I decided to re download it for the shear fun and nostalgia of it. I opened the app up and it asked me to put in my age, so I did. Then, when it was ask me to put in my username, I typed it in, and nothing would happen. I would type in my username and the little button in the bottom right hand corner that is the little check wouldn't work. So when I finally figured out to put away the keyboard on my screen, still nothing would happen. I'd tap everywhere on my screen, I tried reentering my username, but still, not a thing would let me play. I tried doing other things like closing and opening the app over and over again to see if it would work, but no. I even tried deleting the game and reinstalling it.At that point, I almost just gave up, when I even checked to see if other games would work. I downloaded a few apps on my phone and they all worked perfectly fine. So I don't think it's just a problem my phone has, but I'm not sure. I hope that this is a problem that only I have, but if it isn't, then I wish for this to be fixed soon.This bug doesn't change how much I love the game however. I'm sure that it's the same entertaining game that I played years ago as a kid, so I highly recommend it to everyone else who is thinking about getting this game.üå±üÜöüßü‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

name: The game got hit with the EA Hammer da
title: The game got hit with the EA Hammer da
text: Ok, I LOVE plants vs zombies. It has a special place in my heart. My favorite thing about the game is the fact that once you finish the game, you get all sorts of mini games to play. I even got got mods on the PC version to play the Limbo Page. But I was shocked to see that you need to buy mini games individually. Not only did you need to pay for mini games, but mini games are EXPENSIVE. You need 50,000 coins for just one pack of mini games! And considering how many packs there are, the only realistic way to get all of the packs are with newly-introduced MICROTRANSACTIONS! And microtransactions in PvZ? Wth. And also stuff in the shop costs a lot of coins. And you can get coins with micro transactions. Due to the amount of money stuff is in the shop, this basically means that PvZ has PtW elements. Say that again, PAY TO WIN ELEMENTS IN PVZ.

name: A Great game over monetized by EA
title: A Great game over monetized by EA
text: So like many of us plants vs zombies was one of those great games from our childhoodI‚Äôm sure a lot of us downloading it today onceHad a tablet and enjoyed it way back in the dayLooking back on it this was a very well designed game, simple and funthat being said it‚Äôs not perfectnow unfortunately a lot of the flaws in this game today at least on mobile revolve around EA and their purchase of popcap gamesOriginally this was a paid game costing 0.99-$5 I can‚Äôt remember exactly how much but I know it was under $10 Regardless once you bought the game you got everything, all the Minigames, extras and had an ad free experience EAs first move when getting popcap back in 2011 was making this game free to play with ads and a remove ad purchaseAnd when you went ad free you were truly ad free and would never see another ad in this game againNow that was all fine and dandy except for one thing, people who had previously purchased the game lost their ad free experience and felt ripped offNow that‚Äôs already bad as it isBut mistakes happen right? Well luckily despite it going free to playAt the time you could still purchase all the in game extras and mini games with in game coins (so basically they were free unlockables)So the game was left alone for a few years onward...until EA decided that they are now going to take this game and monetize it so much that it makes people sick Once this update came outAll of a sudden the game would bombard players even after the ad free purchase to watch ads for in game rewards like rakes, ‚Äúexplode-o-nuts‚Äù and extra plant slotsAnd even lawn mowers when the game sees one row doesn‚Äôt have one and a zombie gets too closeGranted these were optional advertisements but they were still annoying to have around and you couldn‚Äôt hide them So Rip OCD people I guessBest way to handles this would‚Äôve been to just let ad free players skip the ad and get the extras offered to them without watching an ad because y‚Äôknow they paid to remove the adsSo going ad free didn‚Äôt truly mean going ad free anymore and on top of that You Know Those Those mini games crazy Dave sells?Yeah those now cost real money?Why? BECAUSE HE‚ÄôS CRAZY!!Also for some reason EA took the Menus and made them junk too which also stinksSo all in all EA took this game and gave it the EA Treatment to say the leastNow because I‚Äôm a sucker for all time classics of course I just bought the as removal but honestly I feel gross even doing that especially because of the reasons mentioned aboveI firmly believe this game is best experienced on an older versionToo bad that isn‚Äôt exactly a very practical option

name: This is one of the greatest games of all time
title: This is one of the greatest games of all time
text: I need to make something clear, when I say that this game is the greatest of all time, I mean it. This game is one of the best looking games with its visual style being pleasing on the eyes, it‚Äôs music being so catchy that you get it stuck in your head you don‚Äôt want to get it out, it plays amazingly, having rock solid mechanics and an insanity satisfying gameplay loop, and the story and characters are simple, but charming and extraordinarily memorable. The game is one of the greatest that has ever been made, and this version even fixes a lot of the problems that I have had with other versions of this game. This game is the best out of all of the franchise and is the greatest game you could ever have on your phone.

title: Extremely well made game
name: Extremely well made game
text: I love nearly everything about this game. In my opinion it is one of the best games on the appstore and I‚Äôll explain why.The game is completely and utterly unique in theme, planting plants to defend your house from incoming zombies. Now that‚Äôs already a great game that you could play for a pretty long time, but eventually you‚Äôd get bored of it. They knew this and added plenty of mini games for you to entertain yourself with and it gives the game much more longevity. Also all the levels are not too hard but easy enough that you don‚Äôt have to redo them millions of times.I love crazy Dave, I think he is a hilarious character but that‚Äôs not the only reason I think he‚Äôs great. Other games will have characters who are entertaining like him but most of those are mono dimensional, and they don‚Äôt really effect the plot. Yet Crazy Dave is intertwined perfectly. He is your guide for the basics of lawn safety via plants.I think the art design is really good, it‚Äôs not too extremely realistic, but it‚Äôs not too cartoony either. I love the soundtrack it fits the game really well, it really captures the essence of the game. I love all the little things you can do around the menus as well.I love the entire currency system, unlike many other games it only has one currency. I like that you purchase everything you need from the back of crazy Dave‚Äôs van and I like the zen garden concept as well.That‚Äôs why I think this is one of the best games on the appstore.

title: The Gameplay of Plants vs. Zombies
name: The Gameplay of Plants vs. Zombies
text: Hello and welcome to Plants vs. Zombies and I am so glad you are here! For today‚Äôs gameplay, drag the plants in the grass and collect the falling sun. You can get more plants and play more games to play. We are not going to let the zombies inside the house. But it‚Äôs okay. You can play and fight the evil or the zombies. You can use More Ways to Play and play Mini Games Mode or Puzzle Mode. You can buy and get your money at Crazy Dave‚Äôs Shop. Play the Bonus Game with Plants vs. Zombies Gameplay Mode. Leaderboards and Achievements are using Game Center with Turns, Friends, Challenges, Requests and Games. Download on the App Store and search ‚ÄúPlants vs. Zombies‚Äù on the iPhone and iPad. Be good and have fun!

I restart my phone, close out of other apps, delete stuff to free up space - all the things that could possibly be causing this on my end - and none of it helps. Developers: PLEASE fix this. text: I used to love playing this game and decided to redownload it. The lawn mowers take away from the purpose of the game and make it really really easy. Even if they get through you have another chance. title: Great Game / EA kys
name: Great Game / EA kys
text: Absolute classic and amazing game from Popcap. I was so happy to see it again updated for newer iOS that I almost don‚Äôt want to give it the abysmal rating that it truly deserves since EA has so thoroughly ruined it like everything else they touch. I can tell endless Survival has been re-engineered to demand you to watch ads and buy powerups with real $ to progress and succeed, just like the outright horror that was PvZ2. I even stooped to watching one such ad since I had lost a lawnmower and it was bugging me, and then I didn‚Äôt get my reward anyway. So that‚Äôs straight up inexcusable. The entire game is littered with ads, offers, and general shameless groveling for money; and unless you purchase the ad-free version (for which $3.99 is a war crime in and of itself) which I would normally excuse as being the ‚Äúreal‚Äù price of the app, EA remands you to 2 separate 30-second ads every single level you play. To reiterate, if you don‚Äôt pay $4 for the upgrade, you have to watch a minute of degenerate, unskippable ads per level just to play the base game. And just to salt the wound, EA doesn‚Äôt offer this option for purchase until 10 or so levels in. This flippant rape of a genuinely good mobile game I once loved is more personally offensive to me than being slapped directly in the face or any racial slur I‚Äôve ever been called‚Äîcorrect or otherwise. I hope to one day enjoy a Popcap game not licensed by EA, or at least for every perverse, unfeeling, Godless executive slime at EA to be tried at the Hague at the soonest convenience.

text: While gameplay wise the game is amazing and always will be, it‚Äôs one of the single greatest mobile games ever made. I‚Äôve seen a few forum posts about this issue one on apple says to contact the creators but I‚Äôve searched and I‚Äôve not been able to come up with anything conclusive all I know is a few years back an IOS update caused it to stop working, I can‚Äôt find a solution or even a concrete reason as to why this is. Beyond that these forum posts are a few years old and the fact that the game is being updated but this issue hasn‚Äôt been solved is mind blowing to me, maybe it is a rare issue, there is so little information on this I can‚Äôt even confirm or deny that. name: EA is at it again
title: EA is at it again
text: PVZ is a game that I grinded years ago, and is an amazing classic game I will never forget.  Although this game is great, EA has decided to pick up this game and throw it in the micro transaction dumpster, and fill the game with countless ads, forcing you to go in airplane mode or disconnect from the internet entirely. The high priced mini games can force you to spend money to get them if you would rather not spend months trying to earn them.I‚Äôm not sure if anyone else has found this out, and I‚Äôm not 100 percent sure it‚Äôs still in the game because it‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôve played, but I have an easy way to get around the high priced mini games. Go into endless last stand mode, and plant multiple rows of marigolds, and a few golden magnet shrooms. In front of them, plant a row of Gatling peas, and if you can, plant a row of torchwoods. You should be able to survive at least 5 waves, and you can easily get thousands of coins from this.

name: Needs a bug fix
title: Needs a bug fix
text: The recent update seems to been causing problems. The game audio will occasionally crackle, usually when starting it up, at the beginning of a level, or when an ad plays. More importantly, add will often freeze or crash the game. The majority of ads automatically direct you to the App Store page (which is annoying in itself), and returning to the game will often freeze it. Ads will occasionally freeze as well, and their sound effects will play on loop. I‚Äôm not sure if this has been fixed yet, but there was also a glitch I encountered in the previous version where saving & quitting a level while coin was visible would render the save file totally unplayable. name: EA ruined this game with ads
title: EA ruined this game with ads
text: When I was younger, this was by far my favorite game to play. I would constantly try and beat the next level, but I could never defeat the final boss at the end. I was excited when I saw it optimized for the new phones so I could finally beat the game without my fathers help, but now I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed. Both before and after every level, I have been forced to watch a 30 second ad that cannot be skipped. It happens whenever you switch menus or do really anything in the game, which makes it infuriating to play. The game also freezes a ton during each round, which causes you to restart the game and watch another ad upon re-entry, even making you lose all progress. On top of that, everything is nearly impossible to do without spending money for the mini games which is disheartening. Those used to be a ton of fun to play, but now I can only play one and then have to grind 2 more hours to do even one more. I loved this game when I was younger, but now it is almost impossible to play which makes me feel awful. Why did EA do anything to this game? It was perfect before, but now it‚Äôs only a money grab.

name: Read this, it will help.
title: Read this, it will help.
text: This game is amazing. I didn't know much about it for a long time... I went to a friendly‚Äôs one time and played this on there device thingy... it was awesome I downloaded it on my iPad the next day. I loved it I kept playing and playing made it to ~100,000-~110000Which is ALOT. I had issues with my old iPad I still played though. I slowly stoped. For a year.But then I got my phone. It has been over a year I got it. And yes I love it again. There was a gnome for achievements and now it‚Äôs gone... I did my research and Idk y you removed it. I hope you add it back but great game none the less. I have played this game for 5 days and am already at 16k score and I am going for all the extra game modes again. Way more adds. I love my phone making adds so much easier... but some adds FORCE you to go to the app store and you need to double click and press PvZ to go back. It‚Äôs fine for me, but if you have a bad device I don‚Äôt know if this is playable and I hope you can play this gameI did more research... turns out EA bought it... that‚Äôs y. So I went trough reviews and saw that people are mad about the adds as they should. (If you have a bad device) apparently if you but the remove adds it doesn‚Äôt work so don‚Äôt buy that. Coins and also much harder to get now... I have to do a ‚ÄúGold farm‚Äù with marigolds in survival endless just to get 10k-15k gold... and that‚Äôs 30 minutes this game now requires much more pay .99-3.00 to win, I am a child to teen all my time playing this so I can‚Äôt, I might try tho ;) but yah. I‚Äôm not happy with EA at all. The good out-ways the bad. Old devices I don‚Äôt recommend. I‚Äôve also seen some issues for the iPhones 11-12 not logging in so watch out with brand new also...I love this game. It‚Äôs was the only game to rival angry birds... I didn't play it back then but that is a feat and a half. Great job POPCAPNot EA.Gnome(Achievements)-less adds-coins fixed-login issues for the old-new devices-and possibly just more things to the home screen to make it more and more nostalgic-Add a way to see friends possibly, or a way to play together, but still keep the regular modes ofc. (For solo player) Thank you for this amazing game

name: Game has been ruined
title: Game has been ruined
text: I frequently come back to this game over the years because of how much fun i have playing it. I decided to download it again only to find out its been completely ruined with ads at the start and end of every single level AND now has unnecessary in-game purchases. Not to mention the home screen layout has changed, making it dull and less appealing to the eye. One of the reasons i enjoyed pvz, was because of the pace of the game. It was easy to get lost playing for hours. That has been taken away with the constant video ads thrown in at the beginning and ending of every level. It makes it very apparent just how long you‚Äôve been playing when you‚Äôre sitting there waiting for an ad to finish. Making me less likely to continue playing, let alone continue playing for hours on end. 1‚≠êÔ∏è

name: Disappointed
title: Disappointed
text: I understand that EA wants to make money. They‚Äôre a huge corporation with potential for plenty of profit. However, that gives them no right to tarnish a game this full of quality and nostalgia. If you remember, they FIRED the creator of Plants vs Zombies, because he disagreed with the pay-to-win route EA wanted to take the game. They had the gall to take this man‚Äôs pride and joy from his hands, and ruin its name. If EA has to make profit by taking other people‚Äôs work and riddling it with demands for more money, they do not deserve said profit, or their prestige.

text: First things first, I absolutely love the original pvz. However, EA has mad the game next to unplayable with advertisement frequency. You get ads looking through the menu, opening the app, changing menus, visiting the zen garden or shop, and - of course - double ads after finishing a level. It‚Äôs not uncommon for me to get up to 4 unskipable video ads before I have the chance to even play a level. It‚Äôs unbelievable how much of a money grab it is. The game was made in 2009! You haven‚Äôt changed anything! Why so many ads?!?! If you do decide to get the app for a nostalgia blast, play it on airplane mode and airplane mode only to escape the ads. EA doesn‚Äôt deserve to wring any more money out of this game.

title: ü§©Amazing‚ú®
name: ü§©Amazing‚ú®
text: Hey so if your considering I don‚Äôt have any thing to say and I‚Äôm trying to make the reviews that I put on apps shorter so here‚Äôs some things that I love about the game bc I  have nothing bad to say!1: the graphics and plot of the game is amazing ,fun,funny,and overall amazing!2:the number of different plants you can have is great. Not to many, and not too little. 3:the different maps are great and I like how you have to accomplish things in one map to get another one.4:how the maps tie into the plot is amazing!5: I know I‚Äôve been talking about a ‚Äústory that comes along with it‚Äù a ton. I‚Äôll evaluate on that. So once you have accomplished certain things in the starting map, the crazy dude and his van show up, and that‚Äôs where the story begins. They take you back in time to ancient Egypt and it gets harder and harder. I haven‚Äôt completed all the maps yet but I will probably update this once I have.  6: overall if you have taken the time to read all of this or at least skimmed through it, you‚Äôll know that I talked this game up a lot. And I have good reasons above! It‚Äôs an amazing game and I recommend it to everybody and anybody!!7: Have a great day and remember nobody‚Äôs perfect!

name: Lost my progress randomly! :c
title: Lost my progress randomly! :c
text: PROBLEM: I was in the Fog levels when an ad popped up, so naturally I went to Airplane Mode so that I could just play the game with no ads(hacker 100)Unfortunately, my progress was completely deleted, even when I restarted the app several times...it even deleted the volume and vibration settings I had in the menu, but weirdly enough it kept my username? It was frustrating...I had just gotten the ‚Äúchill out‚Äù achievement, man! Sad day...I also looked at a few recent reviews and it looks like I am not the only one who lost their progress recently, so its definitely a problem that needs to be fixed, take care of it please and thank you :)Also something similar happened earlier in the week, but it was fixed when I restarted the app. I‚Äôm just trying to give as many helpful details as I can, good luckGAME REVIEW: I LOVE this game, even with the ads its really fun(just put it on no wifi/airplane mode guys to fix that)I highly recommend to anyone looking to pass some time with a classic tower defense adventure game, because it really is a good game. Seriously. Out of all the video games I‚Äôve ever played any console, any age, any genre, I‚Äôd rank this game in AT LEAST the top 3 games I‚Äôve ever played. It‚Äôs got good music, fun story/concept, challenging but not too much, this game has it all! So thank you developers and other peeps who made this gameüëå I am very grateful. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è<-obviously 5 stars well deserved.

name: Fun and funny, just a tad buggy. Please fix Survival: Night!
title: Fun and funny, just a tad buggy. Please fix Survival: Night!
text: A classic combination of horror and comedy, in a tower defense format. The "plants" that defend your home are cleverly designed to allow players to come up with creative solutions to the waves of zombie hordes that approach. The levels require ever more vigilance until you reach a frenetic pace, and with tons of game variations, it's hard to get bored.Some specific bugs: I recovered my earlier ads-free game purchase with some trouble; after several errors stating it had failed, it seemed to work, but didn't, then, after a few more attempts, did work. Also, sadly, every time I go to "More Ways to Play," choose "Survival," then pick "Survival: Night," I'm bounced out of the app to the home screen.

name: Fun game, best enjoyed with WiFi turned off.
title: Fun game, best enjoyed with WiFi turned off.
text: Plants Vs Zombies, one of my favorite game franchises of all time. While opinions of the 2nd game differ a lot, most of the majority agree the 1st was great. The greatness is still here, but after every single level, or after any push of a button while traversing the menu, an add plays. I can understand it, as Plants Vs Zombies is now free (there was 2 apps for the 1st game on mobile a few years ago; Plants Vs Zombies, which was free and add less, and PvZ free, which had adds.) Due to this, I‚Äôd suggest having WiFi turned off. It removes adds, like in PvZ2, but unlike PvZ2, this game doesn‚Äôt have arena or Penny‚Äôs Pursuit, or Pi√±ata Parties, those 3 examples give you good reason to keep WiFi on. PvZ doesn‚Äôt have that, the only thing you‚Äôll not be able to do is accidentally click on the explode o‚Äô nut button while trying to shovel a plant, or have to option to watch an add for a free mini game.  Asides from the app, PvZ is a phenomenal game with 100 levels (2 playthroughs of adventure, the second has different levels itself) tons of extra mini games which could be entirely different stuff, like Zombiquarium, or fun gimmicks on normal gameplay, and if that‚Äôs not enough, you  have puzzles, which also have endless modes you can test your skill at. Along with survival which you can really get OP strats on, there is tons to do here. Plants vs Zombies is completely worth your time, and the adds are technically optional, it haven‚Äôt already, I‚Äôd suggest giving it a download; I bet you‚Äôd have fun.

name: This Game is the Bomb
title: This Game is the Bomb

name: An honest review
title: An honest review
text: Ah the original PvZ game. Truly iconic. Before we get into the negatives let‚Äôs get the great stuff out the way, this game is absolutely amazing. The game is deep with many levels, mini games, and survival modes makes the game so fun to replay along with the Zen Garden and a bit of a tougher adventure 2. A draw back I have is the game is easy if you know how to cheese it. Puff shroom and potato mine spam makes it too easy if you know what your doing. Adventure 2 is kinda boring since the levels are mostly the same just longer, many times my defense is done by the time the first flag hits. Unlocking mini games ‚Äúwas‚Äù a challenge too but grinding endless should be enough. Overall this game is great, fun, timeless master piece and nothing can change it...... that‚Äôs till you look to your left and see EA breathing down your neck. EA being EA botched this game as well. So many ads, micro transactions, trying its damned hardest to make the game pay to win even though the game isn‚Äôt built for it. This is with other PVZ games and a coming 3D sequel that looks horrible on the way. I wouldn‚Äôt mind too much but opening the game I‚Äôll be greeted by an ad. Selecting something in the menu ad. Going into the game, you guest it, ADS. EA kills everything they touch. Turning a master piece to an AD filled mess that‚Äôll turn off new comers and older players a like. If you have the patience to deal with this kind of stuff then you might enjoy the game but don‚Äôt get it, we need to show EA that we don‚Äôt want ads and micro transactions in games, we need to respond with our time and wallets. They‚Äôll probably take this review down since it‚Äôs poking fun at their ‚Äúcharacter‚Äù and hitting their egos too hard. PvZ I love you and I hope you are freed one day by this terrible company and ads and you can return to your former glory.

I don‚Äôt play halo or clash of clans for the ads, and I don‚Äôt play this game for them either.This game will play an ad with an x so small, it would be faster to exit out of the game rather than go to the AppStore. name: All for money...
title: All for money...
text: There are so many ads now in PvZ it actually hurts me to play sometimes. I have to turn on airplane mode so I don‚Äôt receive an ad each time I complete a level or go to the main menu. They are quite annoying especially since playing before this time there was zero ads. Why did EA have to change this?? Leave the old game to slowly sputter out they literally had to change nothing and the game would still be perfect but they had to go and add so many ads into it.Not only that but a large thing that makes me mad is the fact that marigolds are sold in the shop for $5000 (previously $2500). This is a terrible price when you think about it because of these reasons. The marigold when finally grown to an adult size you get $1000 (one diamond) and can only be sold for $3000 and also in the intermediate levels of growth you get less than $500. This was the whole idea of the marigolds so that players can make a profit but instead you are losing money from buying these. There utterly is no point to them and should be reverted to their previous price of $2500 to ‚Äúreward us nicely‚Äù as Crazy Dave says.I am putting this review as 1 Star because EA and popcap took a great game and made it just annoying. Hopefully this being 1 Star someone might see it but I highly doubt any change will be made. Thank you for reading my frustration!

name: Ads ruined the game
title: Ads ruined the game
text: PVZ 1 was a great game. Fun, a bit challenging, but also something you can pick up and put down without too much fuss so if you have a busy life it‚Äôs a great game to make some progress with a few minutes that don‚Äôt eat away at your entire day. However this reboot version has so many paywalls and ads. Man are the ever so many ads. And to rub salt in the ad induced wounds, they are all longer than the standard 30 second ads. All the ads are long. Easily a whole minute is eaten up with each ad, and you have to watch multiple ads to get the most out of each level. You spend more time watching ads than playing. Not exactly what I want to do with my free time.

name: 5/5 game!!!
title: 5/5 game!!!
text: I have never really played PVZ I only watched videos about it but now after seeing a let‚Äôs play of this game I thought to myself hmmm if a well known YouTuber played this game then I will. After downloading it and reading the reviews I finally opened the game. Note: When ever I play a game I sometimes think of something in my mind like oh so I can watch a ad for a new lawn mower cool!!! Stuff like that. I got good at the game until the level on day where if you beat it you would unlock the purple piranha plant makeover plant. So I played and no matter how good my ways to play the level were I couldn‚Äôt win. After I lost that level I wanted to play a bonus game since I was not really happy on how many zombies were in the level. So I played and beat three waves of vases carrying either plants that you have and a plant the does not attack but turns the zombie away. But also the vases that spawn zombies too and to pass the bonus stage level you needed to break all the vases with zombies and defeat the zombies but also find the best areas to put your plants. Also I have got this game today and it‚Äôs fun!! Also just in case you don‚Äôt know what the PVZ series of games and tv I think?.. Is well basically this is what PVZ is. PVZ is a game known well as PLANTS VS ZOMBIES. In this game you have to defend yourself from zombies who are trying to get you. In order to protect yourself you must plant PLANTS to protect yourself. Also if a row is no longer filled with plants and a zombie is almost at your house a lawn mower will defeat all the zombies in that path of grass. As you complete levels you unlock new plants and items. So far I‚Äôve only unlocked shovel and wal nut bomb. A plant that you wanna plant first every level is the sunflower as SUN also known as the only way to plant your plants. The sunflowers give additional SUN. The reason I‚Äôm saying some stuff in full capital is because some of this is the developers work so I must label it. Yeah I know I‚Äôm weird but anyway you have a few worlds to go too. DAY NIGHT POOL FOG these 4 are the worlds that are able to be played throughout adventure mode. Also there are awards and achievements to unlock if you do a certain thing in the game. As well if you beat a certain amount of levels unlocking either new plants or new items you can play a bonus stage witch is fun. Yes this is a long review but what!! this game is awesome!! üòé 5 stars. ‚≠êÔ∏è

name: Great game, but don't play this version
title: Great game, but don't play this version
text: PvZ is a classic and really good.  But this version is not the best version.  I'd say it is much better to get the Legacy edition on console or PC.  Even though you have to pay for these ones, the quality is much better.  Also, I would suggest the $0.99 version of this game on IOS, but EA took it down and replaced it with this version.  There are pay-to-win mechanics which can be annoying but don't necessarily destroy the experience.  The real turn-off are the ads.  If you get other versions of this game, you won't get ads or in-game purchases.  You'll also get extra features and modes.  This is probably best described as the LITE version of PvZ.  But, it is still PvZ to its core and therefore if you only have access to this version, I definitely suggest it.

name: Declined Over Time
title: Declined Over Time
text: Just redownloaded this classic. I was surprised to see how much worse this has gotten. The biggest problem is obviously the ads. They pop up after a level, guaranteed, and sometimes even BEFORE the level as well. Honestly it‚Äôs pretty sad how much this game has gone down in value. Sometimes, if you get an ad before a level, it can glitch the app and force you to start again. This can even happen after the level and can reset your progress completely on that level. I won‚Äôt go into detail about all of the other minor changes, but just to sum things up, if you‚Äôre here for nostalgia, turn back. Also, if you have in app purchases that you‚Äôve made, don‚Äôt expect to get your money back. Apparently EA is just going to keep it. Honestly, PVZ is an ok game now, a shadow of what it used to be on mobile. I can really only recommend playing if you‚Äôre playing it casually. EA needs to improve. This feels like an ad-ridden shady mobile game. Get it together, EA.

name: The game got EA‚Äôd, what a shame
title: The game got EA‚Äôd, what a shame
text: PvZ, at its core, was a wonderful experience. If you‚Äôre playing this in 2020, I assume you know what the gameplay is. Compared to PvZ2, The adventure mode is streamlined and encourages using a variety of plants in each world, the bonus games are fun, and Zen Garden is a relaxing and simple collectathon if that strikes your fancy. Those are the things it does right.However, going back to play this game now (which I had purchased before it was F2P), the staggering amount of ads they‚Äôve implemented make this a headache to play through. Forced ads before AND after levels, ads to play bonus games, ads to supplement the pathetic amount of coins you get when you used to be able to comfortably buy everything just playing the game. And to top it all off, it‚Äôs clear the game wasn‚Äôt originally designed for ads and they are poorly integrated, since very frequently the level will crash after serving you up the pre-level ad which forces an app restart and watching an ad once more.I understand making it F2P is appealing, but anyone who had purchased the game previously should automatically have the ad-free option unlocked. This wasn‚Äôt done, hence my low score. Play something else.

name: Great game that EA ruined + Terrible bug
title: Great game that EA ruined + Terrible bug
text: Plants Vs. Zombies is an undeniably great game, it‚Äôs a classic. However I was disappointed to find when downloading this app that EA has ruined it, as EA always does. The game is now riddled with advertisements and gives users a pay to win mentality because you can buy all the coins needed for all mini games, last stand, I, Zombie, and Vasebreaker for just a few dollars. Also, the fact that EA makes users spend large sums of coins to unlock those is very scummy if I‚Äôm being honest. Now not only has EA introduced microtransactions into a classic game where they don‚Äôt belong, but they‚Äôve also introduced a horrible bug that‚Äôs cost me multiple Survival Endless runs. If a coin is on-screen when you pause and then leave a level, or advance to the next pair of flags in Survival Endless, the game will crash as soon as you return to the level and resume. There‚Äôs nothing that can be done about this, and you will have to restart your level. This glitch has cost me three runs in Survival Endless, being 16, 26, and 31 flags respectively, which I am obviously unhappy about. If EA were to do anything about this‚Äîfix the bug, make microtransactions less prevalent (or preferably, non-existent), maybe lower the cost of mini games, last stand, I, Zombie, and Vasebreaker, then that would bring my review up to five stars. However I think we all know that none of this will happen.

name: EA + Popcap Ruined It All
title: EA + Popcap Ruined It All
text: PVZ is a great game and all, but EA has completely ruined it. As a kid, I really liked it, and there was so much more that you could do. There are just so many changes that really shouldn‚Äôt have been added. Now, I know these sound like small complaints, but they add up. Now, it is harder to place plants. Something about the graphics just seem off. The zombies don‚Äôt look like they used to. They don‚Äôt look good anymore. Their heads are way, WAY too big. They shouldn‚Äôt have changed it because people like me probably came back for nostalgia. I saw this on the App Store recently, and thought it might be a good throwback to when I was younger, but it wasn‚Äôt. And what the hell happened to the title screen? It doesn‚Äôt look like it used to AT ALL. First, where is the achievement gnome? It was easier to go to the achievements on that, so... why did they change it? It also would have added to the aesthetic. Where did the second gravestone come from? That‚Äôs not supposed to be there. And I know this is on mobile, and this is how they make money, but the ads are RIDICULOUS. Even when I say not to have targeted ads, they do anyway. It‚Äôs also the same terrible TERRIBLE Gardenscapes and Fishdom ads. The ads are just everywhere. You can even get ads for doing nothing on the TITLE SCREEN. Also, WHY CAN‚ÄôT YOU RESTORE PURCHASES ANYMORE? I actually spent some money but now I can‚Äôt even use it even though it was on THE SAME PHONE. Honestly, if you have a PC, I would just get it somewhere else and get an actual version of this game. And don‚Äôt get me wrong, this game is a MASTERPIECE. But like I said, EA ruined it. They have completely ruined the whole series. And don‚Äôt even get me started on how bad PVZ 3 is. It‚Äôs terrible. It‚Äôs just like PVZ heroes (which was also a huge fail) but much worse. It feels like a cheap knockoff of PVZ. You know something went wrong when the company makes a game, but it feels like a knockoff of that company‚Äôs OWN game. It‚Äôs actually hilarious how much EA screwed up PVZ as a whole. It‚Äôs pretty pathetic. Get it together, EA.

name: What happened?
title: What happened?
text: Me along with a lot of people found this game extremely fun and was a great nostalgic game. I came back to the game to go to a childhood of happier times, and I wanted to beat the game because 6 year old me never could. The game is now covered with adds like every other crappy mobile free game. Everyone would be happier if you had to pay for the game and there were no adds so we could experience plants vs zombies and not sh*t simulator. The fact that you can watch an add to get things that get you a free win and get rid of any challenge like watch an add for an explosive wall nut. Or even watch an add that will get you a thing that kills 1 zombie and cost 200 coins. Also the new format with adventure mode having the levels instead of quick play, that made it so if you wanted to play bonus games, you could (I did that a lot). Also what happened to the ending credits with the amazing song ‚Äùthere‚Äôs a zombie on our lawn‚Äù hearing that was so nice and rewarding and now it‚Äôs just a boring thing that nobody is going to watch. This would be over 5 stars if it had no adds, and have the credits song that people actually care about back. Nobody wants to watch the current credits thing. Even bringing back the old loading screen would make it better. Ea, you can be money hungry and charge to much for to little but this is to f*cking far. Go away you sack of PLEASE PAY 5 $ OR WATCH AN ADD TO SEE THE REST OF THIS COMMENT üò†

name: What happened?
title: What happened?
text: This game is now a barren wasteland of EA‚Äôs cash cow antics. Ads.Constant ads thrown into your face ruin the flow that Adventure Mode once had.The new level selection screen chops up the flow of Adventure mode, and just feels like an excuse to shove more ads down your throat (not one, but two ads between each level, one when you complete a level and one when you start a new level)The graphics changed for the worse: awkward text placement is everywhere, among other graphics problems littered over this once-legendary game. The graphics-related errors make the game feel like it was taken apart and thrown back together, without care.This now-charmless game is a shell of its former self. Back in the day, this game brought me happiness. Now, the only feeling I get from playing it is disgust at how mercilessly a great game was torn to shreds.EA does not care about making a good game. They only care about how much money they make, sacrificing the happiness of the players. Corporate greed has destroyed Plants vs. Zombies.

name: Amazing game until EA bought it
title: Amazing game until EA bought it
text: I have play PvZ for my whole life, I started play when I was six and now I am sixteen. I wanted to download PvZ for my phone and I when I did, I was not happy. PvZ mobile was amazing and fun about eight years ago when actual good PvZ mobile was removed from the App Store. I still have the app on my iPad. Listen EA if you don‚Äôt start listening to your consumers, fix these problems, and stop spamming the ads on everything then no one will want to play or purchase your games. Heck, I would be surprised if you guys survive another two years. PvZ and many other games were great until EA ruined it.

name: Just like back in 2009.
title: Just like back in 2009.
text: I remember playing this game on my old desktop computer back in highschool. I played it so many times I already lost count. Just randomly thought to play this again this time around because I was bored. Lucky for me it‚Äôs still the same PvZ I knew and loved. Also paid the 3$ no-ads purchase because I think that‚Äôs worth all the hours I‚Äôve spent (and will spend) on this game. Only thing that bothers me is that even though I paid the no-ads thing, I still have to view ads for special add-ons (rake, exploding wallnut, extra plant slot, etc.). Wish that was included in the 3$ purchase. But it‚Äôs not really a dealbreaker for me though. Still love this! This is how a mobile game should be. Simple and no frills.

name: Poked the eyes out of Mona Lisa
title: Poked the eyes out of Mona Lisa
text: One of the classic iOS games is now little more than a vehicle for trapping fun seekers into forced watching of advertisements for other games which are likely also delivery mechanisms for other ads for other games. I‚Äôd buy the garbage away if I could just to lose hours playing this almighty game.  Somebody has pooped on this awesome game and got greedy trying to buy themselves ad revenue with other people‚Äôs time, remarkably while also destroying any chance that if ever look twice at something that says ‚Äúpop cap‚Äù again.  Some careless soul either underestimated how much people would pay for a game they love, or overestimated how much they love it thinking they would waste their time watching garbage in between every level.   Yes, that‚Äôs how bad these forced wait ads are. I‚Äôd pay $5 or even more for this game but it‚Äôs getting uninstalled instead. Sad.

text: I absolutely love this game. However, there are a few issues with it. Things cost way too much. You have to spend coins to buy the mini games, and the amount is ridiculous. I have completed every level, and I‚Äôm disappointed in how they tried to keep it going. They just have you replay eve try single level, except for they pick three of the plants for you. name: EA Bad
title: EA Bad
text: This game is incredible. However, EA pulled the original app (luckily still installed on my iPhone and iPad) but now this one has been visually stretched out in a very ugly way to accommodate larger phone displays. Additionally, there are adds after almost every level completed and optional adds to acquire a rake or additional plant. Initially I paid $3 for the app and received an incredible game. Unfortunately EA pulled that game and added this free version. It‚Äôs like someone going back and adding duck lips to the Mona Lisa. Not only did EA mess with what was arguably a perfect game, but they added bloat, adds, and constant interruptions that make the game lose the charm and flow. After PvZ2 I didn‚Äôt think I could be more disappointed until I found out they even went back and messed with the originally. EA, we don‚Äôt like you. Stop ruining games with your greedy mentally. Ever think it would be nice to create a good game people love and not just something designed to take money and ruin user experience?

name: I will always love PVZ, just not the mobile version.
title: I will always love PVZ, just not the mobile version.
text: Aside from ads popping up randomly every time you click something, try to play, or even just beat a level. I still love the gameplay. Cause airplane mode, no ads. But the price of mini games, is beyond ridiculous, due to the fact that the only way of getting you these high coin amounts, is to hope for plants from playing the Adventure over and over, grinding for hours, or purchasing from the store. Plus the decreased value of gold coins from 100->50 was completely unnecessary. The only reason for it being done, is the hopes of people spending money for mini games. So over all 2* , they‚Äôre going for to much of a cash grab, for all the people like myself who love the game, who wanna replay every aspect, but not grind for hours on end.

name: Paid to remove ads, still unplayable
title: Paid to remove ads, still unplayable
text: I paid a few months ago to remove ads. That worked for about a week. Now I‚Äôm back to having so many ads that game is almost unplayable. There are ads between every round, ads before and after every bonus game, ads when I visit my zen garden, etc. I spend more time stuck in ads than playing. I‚Äôve contacted EA three separate times (before the lockdown) about it. First time they never responded. Second time they told me it was third party apps playing the ads (lie) and that I need to track down the app and delete it. So apparently according to EA, the inability to restore your purchase of no ads isn‚Äôt their fault (it just hangs on connecting to server when you click restore) it‚Äôs some invisible third party that they‚Äôre not responsible for and that only affects their game and no others. Third time, a response to their third party app theory, got no response. I know it‚Äôs only 3 bucks, but how many people are they ripping off? Reinstalling the game doesn‚Äôt fix it.

title: Not so good
text: This is a fun game app.  You get addicted Killing the zombies and planting the plants to defend your brain.  Also, there are tons of mini games too. name: EA won‚Äôt honor original purchase ADS EVERYWHERE
title: EA won‚Äôt honor original purchase ADS EVERYWHERE
text: I paid for this game on my computer some years ago and loved the game. Later, I bought it again to put on my mobile devices; iPad and iPhone.  But Electronic Arts, who used to be a great developer, has learned from other app developers that mostly target kids, that if you hold back in giving rewards for earned items through good play, you can squeeze a nine year old for $4.99 to use something he should be able to learn through strategic play. Not only once, but twice and wait, every single time! Sure you can watch a video for free whoopeeee and get a rake. You know, the one you used to be able to buy from Dave after getting through so many levels and earning coins, that stayed with you permanently. I‚Äôm really disappointed to see how far EA has fallen.

name: This. Is. Zombacolypse.
title: This. Is. Zombacolypse.
text: The ultimate zombie defense game. Such a basic concept: a group of various plants defend against incoming hordes of brain-craving zombies. And it‚Äôs brought out to perfection, equal parts style and substance. The gameplay may be simple, but never gets old or repetitive. The player(you) plays from the defending plants‚Äô perspective, planting many types of plants in order to keep the zombies from reaching the owner‚Äôs house. As the player progresses through each level, more plants and zombies, among other bonus features, are unlocked. The plants, as chosen, work together as a team, having various functions. This is one of my favorite games of all time, and it‚Äôll always live on in my heart.

title: Plants vs Zombies Review
name: Plants vs Zombies Review
text: Plants vs Zombies Introduction Pvz is a free app for many or all devices. It has many levels in the game so people can play it for a while before completing all the levels. I also like how there are many achievements so some people would be more willing to challenge themselves. In my opinion, pvz is a very versatile game and an app for many ages to play. It doesn‚Äôt have any extremely gory scenes when the zombies die. When playing pvz, you have to use strategy , prior knowledge,    and experience as well as some trial and error. The game is also a free and (in my opinion) fun app to play.Problems or Issues (The ones I have experienced)The game occasionally glitches , especially in those moments where you‚Äôre so close to beating a level , as well as in the very beginning. When you actually complete an achievement , sometimes the game doesn‚Äôt recognize it so you have to try doing it again. Final Thoughts Plants vs Zombies is a versatile game (in my opinion) because there are levels to complete , mini games to play, achievements to challenge yourself , plants to care for in Zen Garden , and puzzles to try for yourself. The game has a few bugs that need to be fixed , but overall pvz is a free and overall fun game to play.

title: As good as I remember
name: As good as I remember
text: This game is just like the original. I love that there is the option to play a few bonus games daily, earning extra coins and changing it up form the traditional play.  Nice that it doesn‚Äôt force you to have the internet to play like several modern games do- without ads, you just don‚Äôt get access to the daily bonus games. It seems that a lot of the bonus content is really expensive (in game money), but I guess that‚Äôs to help promote spending real money on the game so I get it.Even without spending anything on the game, it is as fun as the original and has a great variety of content. I‚Äôm happy I found this game again!

name: Screw off with your ads, EA, you bunch of sh!tlizards.
title: Screw off with your ads, EA, you bunch of sh!tlizards.
text: Plants versus zombies was a great game. However, I paid for this game years back and cannot download that version of it anymore. You idiots at Electronic Arts re-release it as a game with unavoidable ads even when I purchase the ‚Äúno more ads‚Äù idiocy in the shop (where now you can only buy mini games with hundreds of thousands of coins with the only efficient source of them being micro transactions). I want to unlock the seed slot like I used to, not to have to watch a 30 second ad at the beginning of every bloody level for it despite having paid for the removal of ads. In proper EA fashion, you changed the structure of a classic just to optimize its monetary efficiency with profound insult to the intelligence of your consumers. I won‚Äôt be playing this version of the game for the foreseeable future. In fact, I‚Äôll go out of my way to find the IPA of the original and inject it into my iPhone and play the game the way it was meant to be before I give you gluttonous morons another cent of AdRev.
